required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: rTMS for PTSD Comorbid With Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: 5Hz Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Comorbid With Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see how well a treatment called "Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation" works for patients who struggle with symptoms of both posttraumatic stress disorder and major depressive disorder.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the safety and efficacy of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) for adults with comorbid posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and major depressive disorder (MDD). Although standard rTMS uses stimulations delivered to the left prefrontal cortex at 10 pulses per second, prior work has shown that other stimulation frequencies may work for both PTSD and MDD. In this study, we examine the efficacy of left-sided 5Hz in patients with PTSD and MDD, hypothesizing that this lower frequency will improve PTSD and MDD symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of 5 Hz rTMS on self-reported PTSD symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Improvement in self-rated scales for PTSD (e.g., PTSD checklist [PCL])

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of 5 Hz rTMS on self-reported MDD symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Improvement in self-rated scales for MDD (e.g., Inventory of Depressive Symptoms Self-Report [IDSSR], PHQ-9)

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvements in Quality of life associated with 5 Hz rTMS
secondary_outcome.description: Improvements in self-rated quality of life (e.g., quality of life questionnaire [Q-LES-Q])

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvements in patient and clinician rated global impression
secondary_outcome.description: Improvements in global clinical status (e.g., CGI-S)

arm_group.description: 5Hz delivered over L DLPFC. Intensity: 120% of Motor Threshold, 5 Sec Train, 14 Sec Inter-Train Interval, Frequency: 5Hz, Total Pulses: 3000

intervention.description: Stimulating DLPFC at 5 Hz for up to 40 treatment sessions overall. 35 sessions delivered over 7 weeks, and final 5 treatments delivered in taper over 3 weeks. There will be a post treatment assessment 72 hours after final treatment, and then again 1 month after the final treatment.

link.description: Online ahead of print article with all methods and results
